newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai oil agency signs pact to buy crude oil.
newsitem.headline: Thai oil agency signs pact to buy crude oil.

text.p: State-run Petroleum Authority of Thailand (PTT) on Thursday signed a memorandum of understanding to buy all the crude oil from the Tantawan field in the Gulf of Thailand, a PTT official said.
Under the agreement, Thaipo Ltd, the concessionaire of the field, will start supplying 6,000-8,000 barrel per day of crude to PTT, starting from late December this year.
Thaipo is a joint venture between Thai Romo Ltd, a unit of U.S.-based Rutherford-Moran Oil corp and Sophon Thai Gulf Ltd which is linked to Bangkok Bank.
The official said the quality of the crude was similar to that of Tapis grade from Malaysia.
The Tantawan field also produces natural gas. PTT last year signed an agreement to buy 100 million cubic feet per day of the product from the field.
